speaker: Skyline
text: The light at the top of the space needle glows._   [_Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa Roz is seated at the table with a friend, Ann, who is quite obviously a rather chatty, but pleasant woman._]

speaker: Ann
text: Does he wear jewelry?  Because I don't do "man jewelry."

speaker: Roz
text: He doesn't wear jewelry.

speaker: Ann
text: What about skin issues?  Because I have a thing against tags, growths, any kind of fleshy masses.

speaker: Roz
text: Ann, he's male and his heart is beating.  What else do you need to know?

speaker: Ann
text: Okay, yeah.  [_Frasier enters._]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I came as quickly as I could.  What's the emergency?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, no, it's not an emergency, it's just...

speaker: Ann
text: [_interrupting, taking Frasier's hand_] Hi.  I'm Ann Hodges. I'm divorced.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sitting_] I'm sorry.  I'm Dr. Frasier Crane.

speaker: Roz
text: I thought you two would like to meet.  Ann is in insurance.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry she dragged you all the way down here.  I've just renewed my policy, but perhaps Roz could introduce you to my brother Niles.

speaker: Ann
text: Is he single?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, but with a baby on the way, he might need some additional coverage.

speaker: Ann
text: Super.  Well, thanks a lot, Roz, this was _totally_ worth a drive across town. [_She exits._]

speaker: Roz
text: Are you dense?  I was trying to set you guys up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why would you do that?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, maybe because you haven't had a date in ages, and it's starting to show.  What is that, your purse?

speaker: Frasier
text: This is a grocery tote.  I wanted to pick up some vegetables and some cat food at the market.

speaker: Roz
text: You did not get a cat.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I am catsitting for a neighbor, and I go out.  I'm going out this evening.

speaker: Roz
text: With whom?

speaker: Frasier
text: People.

speaker: Roz
text: People you're related to?

speaker: Frasier
text: They're still people.  Listen, Roz, I may not go out as often as you do, but that's because I have standards.  Haven't you ever heard of waiting for Miss Right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, well, Miss Right has standards too, and she's not looking to meet Mr. Mothballs.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can smell that?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Roz
text: You need a placeholder: someone you can go out with and just keep your dating muscles toned.  That way you'll be ready when Miss Right comes along, and Ann Hodges is a born placeholder.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't want to go out with somebody I'm not interested in.  I would rather wait for Miss Right, and while I'm waiting, there's no reason I can't live a rich and rewarding life.  Now if you'll excuse me, I need to get these vegetables home and into a hearty winter soup.  [_Kenny enters.  Frasier rises._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, hi, guys.  Hey, Doc!  You're always free.  My cousin's in town, why don't you help me show her the city?

speaker: Frasier
text: Did Roz put you up to this?

speaker: Roz
text: I had nothing to do with it, I swear to God.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Kenny, but I am booked all this weekend.  Oh, here's luck!  I found a perfectly good thimble in this pocket! See you later.  [_He exits._]

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks anyway.

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, I tried.  [_Fade out._]  **THE FIFTH WHEEL**  [_Scene 2 - A fancy restaurant (Chez Henri?) The party of Niles, Daphne, Martin, Ronee, and Frasier are waiting at the counter to be seated._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_over fade-in_] Reservation for Crane.

speaker: Maitre d'
text: [_French accent_] For four, sir?

speaker: Niles
text: No, sorry, for five. [_Frasier raises his hand._] We added one.  [_Niles smiles, irritated but tolerant, at Frasier._]

speaker: Maitre d'
text: All we have is a table for four.

speaker: Ronee
text: We can all squeeze.  This one's always on my lap after the second drink anyway.  [_She playfully rubs Martin's cheek.  He laughs._]

speaker: Maitre d'
text: Very well, Madam. [_to a waiter, under his breath and irritated_] Get the chair.  [_He leads them to their table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, there's really no need to go to all this trouble.  I have a perfectly good winter soup back home.  [_They all respond with "Oh, no," "Don't be silly," etc._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, um, Well, um...  [_He sits in the chair that the waiter has placed on the side of the table.  It is "too low," and the table is about on the level of Frasier's chest._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, do you have anything higher?

speaker: Maitre d'
text: [_condescending_] Sorry, Sir.  I will look for a cushion.  [_He exits._]

speaker: Martin
text: So Fras, tell everybody about that new antique you picked up today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's-it's a late Regency fruitwood mirror.  Very valuable if it has the original glass, which mine does.

speaker: Martin
text: No!

speaker: Niles
text: What are the odds?

speaker: Martin
text: If you like mirrors, you should see the one Ronee's got in her dressing room.  It's got lights all around the edges, and it has three settings.

speaker: Ronee
text: Yeah, daytime, nighttime, and... yikes.  [_They all laugh.  The waiter approaches._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, excuse me, if I could get a place setting, that would be lovely.

speaker: Daphne
text: What's Inizio Due Cuore?

speaker: Waiter
text: That's our appetizer sampler for two.  A bruschetta for you, a bruschetta for your love, and so on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is it possible to make that for one?

speaker: Waiter
text: [_disbelieving_] One?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_irritated_] Yes, a bruschetta for me, no bruschetta for my love, and so on.

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry, it's _due_ or no.

speaker: Niles
text: That's fine, we'll get two orders and we'll just all share.  [_They all agree with the suggestion._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Very good.  [_He exits.  Another waiter pours their water._]

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm.  Looks delicious.

speaker: Ronee
text: This is fun, you know this is the first time Marty and I have been our with another couple. [_an uncomfortable pause_] And Frasier, it's fun being out with Frasier too.  [_They all agree warmly._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, listen, all of you just knock it off.  [_An elderly man, the restaurant owner, rises from his table._]

speaker: Owner
text: [_announcing_] Welcome everyone!  42 years ago tonight, I married my beautiful Theresa.  And now, we hope that all you loving couples out there will help celebrate our happiness by joining us in a dance.  [_Everyone in the restaurant rises to dance except for their table.  Martin and Ronee begin to sway to the waltz music.  Niles and Daphne uncomfortably study the menu._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'll have the fish, I believe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just go dance!  [_Both couples are glad to do so.  Frasier is now alone.  A waiter comes out of the kitchen with a child's booster seat, which he offers to Frasier as another waiter bumps Frasier on the way back to the kitchen. As the dance continues, Frasier gestures refusal of the booster seat and begins to stew in self-pity.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment Frasier enters, carrying a take-out box.  His new antique mirror stands near the door.  A cat sits on the arm of the couch._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Mr. Bottomsley. [_He hangs up his coat._] Dinner was an absolute nightmare.  Fortunately, I was able to slip out of there early and pick you up a little treat. [_He chuckles, indicating the box._] Fresh tuna.  You're welcome.  [_He plays his phone messages._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_v.o._] Frasier, this is Roz.  Write down this number: 555-0179. Don't get mad, that's Ann's number.  I talked to her, and she really thought you were cute and sweet and...  [_Frasier cuts off the message._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly, why does everyone assume that I need some companionship in my life?  Has the world gone mad, Mr. Bottomsley?  [_He goes to the kitchen.  Mr. Bottomsley follows._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what shall we two bachelors do this evening, Mr. B? Perhaps a crossword puzzle.  Maybe watch a little telly. Oh, I know--how about a nice hot bath? [_Mr. Bottomsley gives Frasier an alarmed, warning look._] I'm just teasing.  Now, I know that you're used to eating canned tuna, so this will taste different, but if you're like me, I think you'll agree it's much better.  If only there were a treat here for me.  Ah, what's this?  A delicious nine- vegetable winter soup. [_He sniffs the soup._] Yes, Mr. B, I think you were right about the bay leaves.  [_Mr. Bottomsley stares. Frasier exits the kitchen with a meal tray. He takes on a British accent._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Mr. Bottomsley, lovely to see you again, sir.  Your customary table, I presume, hmm?  Splendid.  Here you go.  [_He sets the tuna on the coffee table and collapses on the couch. Mr. Bottomsley begins to eat the tuna._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, isn't this civilized.  [_Eddie runs in from the back._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Beat it, Eddie, there's none for you. [_Eddie runs back._] Do you feel a draft, Mr. B?  I'm just a little bit cold. [_He places an afghan over his back like a shawl._] That's better. [_He blows on a spoonful of soup._] Hmm, that's still a little too hot.  You know what, while we're letting that cool, why don't we find a home for our... antique. [_He picks up Mr. Bottomsley and starts to pet him._] There we are, yes, now.  [_He moves to the mirror, still petting the cat._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you don't find one of these very easily.  Especially in such good condition.  Won't that covetous Niles be mad when he sees this, hmm?  But he can't have it, can he, nooo.  Yes, he can't have it, can he, no, no...  [_Throughout the course of this long monologue, Frasier's speech has become more and more mannered, as it does when talking to a pet, with the appropriate voice inflections.  Now he stands in front of the mirror, hunched over with the afghan on his back and stroking the cat more and more ardently.  Upon seeing himself, he realizes..._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_normal voice_] Dear God, I'm Aunt Shirley!  [_He rapidly removes the afghan from his back and unceremoniously drops the cat on the couch, who meows angrily.  He rushes over to the phone to retrieve Roz's message._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What's that number?  [_He punches phone buttons feverishly.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I   ACT II_  [_Scene 4 - The Montana apartment Niles's eastern European maid, Mrs. Gablyczyck, is meticulously cleaning a lampshade with a penknife.  Niles comes down the stairs with some apparently unopened dress shirts._]

speaker: Niles
text: Mrs. Gablyczyck, these new shirts...did Mrs. Crane ask you to buy them for me, because I already have shirts just like these.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_heavy eastern European accent_] No, no, after I wash, I pin them and wrap in plastic.  You not like?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no. [_voice breaking_] I like very much.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: Thank you, mister.  [_The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Mrs. Gablyczyck_] No, no, I'll get it.  [_He opens the door after lovingly setting his shirts on a chair.  It is Martin.  Mrs. Gablyczyck exits._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Dad, come on in.  Daphne'll be right down and we can go. Where's Frasier?

speaker: Martin
text: [_believe it or not_] On a date!

speaker: Niles
text: Get out!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!  About time, huh?  It's like I was saying to Eddie--this guy's got to get a life! [_He sits._]  [_Daphne rushes down the stairs._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles!  I left $60 on the desk yesterday, and now it's gone. Is that proof enough for you?  [_Niles motions to her to lower her voice._]

speaker: Niles
text: Are you sure you didn't misplace it?

speaker: Daphne
text: You know I didn't!

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: Ever since we hired Mrs. Gablyczyck, things have been disappearing-- liquor, money, linens...

speaker: Martin
text: So she's stealing from you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: No, we don't know that.  And frankly it's hard to believe that somebody who'll go out in a rainstorm to clean pigeon muck from the solarium skylight is capable of theft.

speaker: Daphne
text: We can't put up with stealing just because she's good at what she does.

speaker: Niles
text: First of all, she's not just good at what she does, she's it._] She's an artist.

speaker: Martin
text: Tell you what.  You give me five minutes with her, and if she's hiding anything, I'll get it out of her.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, we are not going to coerce a confession out of this woman based on circumstancial evidence.  [_A bell dings.  Mrs. Gablyczyck comes down the stairs._]

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: Oven is clean.  Now I scrub down dishwasher.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Mrs. Gablyczyck, you dropped some...[_disheartened_] money.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_hurriedly picking up the cash_] Thank you, Mister.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, Dad, you've got five minutes.  [_Fade out._]  **SQUIRMIN' LIKE HERMAN**  [_Scene 5 - The fancy restaurant from Scene 2 Frasier and Ann are being seated._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_fade-in_] We'd like your famous appetizer for two, please.

speaker: Maitre d'
text: I'll let your waiter know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much.  [_The maitre d' exits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Ann... tell me everything.  Who is Ann Hodges?

speaker: Ann
text: Wow.  Well, I'm an insurance claims adjustor.  That's what's so funny.  When we met, you thought I was in sales, but I'm not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Ann
text: I'm in claims.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, we don't have to have just shop talk.  What are your dreams?

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, my God.  Well, my dream is to become a _senior_ claims adjustor.  It's sort of the same, but you get a private cube and your own extension.  I would have got it last year, but I paid a big claim the company didn't like.  I knew I goofed the second I did it.  It was just one of those "Shoot!" moments, you know, when you just say "Shoot!"  Do you ever do that, make a big mistake and want to go back in time and just do something different?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_having one of those moments, but smiling bravely_] Oh, yes.

speaker: Ann
text: Well, I'm going to run to the ladies' room.  I just had to have that Dr. Pepper while I was getting dressed.  [_She laughs and exits.  Frasier plays along and sits down as the waiter approaches._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Good evening, sir.  Would you care for something to drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as a matter of fact, I would--I'd like your finest bottle of Barolo, please.  Why don't you come back in a minute and see what the lady likes.  [_The waiter leaves.  Kenny enters with a beautiful brunette._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Doc?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Kenny
text: Hey, small world!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Kenny, hi. [_He rises._]

speaker: Kenny
text: This is my cousin I was telling you about.  This is Dr. Crane.

speaker: Liz
text: Dr. Crane--I heard your show today.  It was great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... is this, uh, your first time in Seattle?

speaker: Liz
text: Yes, it is. I'm a fine arts dealer, but I'm considering a curator position at the Seattle Art Museum.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's impressive.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, that's nothing.  She teaches kids ballet, and she rock climbs. She plays the harp.  Oh, what am I doing.  I haven't introduced you.  Dr. Frasier Crane.  Liz Wright.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_completely beguiled, and recognizing the irony_] It's lovely to meet you... Miss Wright.

speaker: Liz
text: Well, it's too bad you're not free tonight.  You could have joined us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, how about tomorrow night?

speaker: Liz
text: Oh, I'd love to, but I'm on a plane tonight to Amsterdam.  I have a job offer there as well.

speaker: Kenny
text: I'm doing my best to convince her to pick Seattle, but it's tough when you're up against the Dutch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Kenny
text: Could have really used your help there, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know, I'm just about finished up here.

speaker: Liz
text: You know, we wouldn't want to interrupt your date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's not a date.  It's not a date.  It's just a little business thing.  You know, I'll tell you what.  I'll just wrap things up here, and then I'll come and help you wage the battle for Seattle.  [_They laugh._]

speaker: Liz
text: That's great!  We'll see you soon.  Bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye.  [_Ann re-enters._]

speaker: Ann
text: Man, oh man, that place was a madhouse.  I got so tired of waiting I just decided to hold it.  [_They sit._]

speaker: Ann
text: I'm so glad you picked Italian.  I love macaroni.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.

speaker: Ann
text: That's another thing we have in common, I guess.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Well... uh, you know, Ann, uh, first dates are funny. Umm, sometimes it takes a while for two people to click. Sometimes you know right away, and, uh, I think when you do, you should just feel free...

speaker: Ann
text: [_interrupting_] You are so cute.  Click! [_She laughs merrily._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Ann
text: Click, click.  The sound of us clicking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ann, um...

speaker: Ann
text: You don't know what a relief this is.  I've only had one date since my divorce.  Well, half a date.  The jerk actually called it off in the middle of dinner.  I was a wreck.  I didn't get out of bed for a week. [_feigning embarassment_] Or shave my legs.  [_The waiter arrives._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Your appetizers.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_overdoing it_] Oh.  Gosh, this is a feast!  I'm not sure we'll need to order a main course.

speaker: Ann
text: Well, this ain't gonna do it for me.  I'm starvin' like Marvin.  [_Frasier is at a loss and has difficulty maintaining his smile.  Fade out._]  **CZECH, LIES, AND VIDEOTAPE**  [_Scene 6 - The Montana apartment Martin interrogates Mrs. Gablyczyck in the kitchen.  Niles is present._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_fade-in_] Mrs. Gablyczyck, we're friends here.  No one wants to send you to jail or back to your country. We just need you to admit that you took the money.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_seated_] I no take nothing.

speaker: Martin
text: [_suddenly_] Do you want to go to jail!?  Do you want to go back to your country!?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering_] Well, I was hoping it wouldn't come to this, but I'm afraid we're going to have to show her the tape.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: What tape?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's from the surveillance camera.  It shows you stealing. [_after a pause_] You might as well confess, I've got the evidence.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: I want to see tape.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_uncomfortably_] All right.  [_She leads them out of the kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll give you one last chance to tell the truth, Mrs. Gablyczyck, because if we watch this tape, we'll have no choice but to call the police.

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_determined_] I see tape.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right. [_overdramatizing_] I'm putting the tape in. Here I go.  I'm pressing play.  Now I'm switching the input from cable to video.  Niles, get ready to call the police.  [_She is out of options.  The tape plays, and it is Martin's birthday party.  We hear the chorus of "Happy Birthday, dear Dad."_]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, that's me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I used an old tape of your birthday party, but the surveillance part's coming up.  [_dramatizing again_] Last chance, Mrs. Gablyczyck, it's coming up!

speaker: Niles
text: Okay, I have to step in here...

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_giving in_] All right, all right!  I stole.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_surprised she pulled off the bluff_] You did?

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: I didn't think you know.  I bring it back.  [_She exits to the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_dejected_] Well done, Daphne. Oh, but I'm so disappointed, I was really hoping you were wrong.

speaker: Martin
text: [_bending over the television_] Hey, hey, did you see that? Watch this again!

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: You must have put the camera down when we went into the kitchen for ice cream.  Watch Daphne's mother.

speaker: Daphne
text: My mother, she stayed behind to grab her sweater.

speaker: Niles
text: And our candlesticks.

speaker: Daphne
text: And our 20-year-old Scotch!

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: [_entering_] This is plate I brought home.  I take Mrs. Crane's leftover meat pie.  But I brought plate back.

speaker: Niles
text: Mrs. Gablyczyck, we're so sorry.  We've made a terrible mistake.  We know now you didn't steal anything.  Can you ever forgive me?

speaker: Mrs. Gablyczyck
text: Or course, mister.  You're nice man.  And you're nice lady.  [_She glares accusingly at Martin, who tries to hide his discomfort. Fade out._]  [_Scene 7 - The restaurant Continuation of Frasier's unfortunate date_]

speaker: Ann
text: Are you sure that's all the little bunny wants to eat?  Just a little green salad?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not hiding his unhappiness_] The bunny had a big Mexican lunch. You know, if you're feeling full then I'm sure they could wrap up the rest of that for you.

speaker: Ann
text: Oh no, I'm just trying to pace myself so that I'll have room for dessert.  I hear the souffle here is well worth the wait.  [_Frasier looks dejected.  He looks over to Miss Wright, who smiles at him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, I'd better get that!  [_He pulls out his cell phone._]

speaker: Ann
text: That didn't even ring.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it did.  Hello?  Niles?  Is there something wrong?  Oh, dear God, well, you just stay there on the floor.  I'll be right there. [_putting the phone away and rising_] I'm so sorry, uh...

speaker: Ann
text: Is everything all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, it's my brother.  He's thrown out his back again. Oh, God, right in the middle of our magical evening too! [_to the passing waiter_] Uh, check please.  Thank you.  You know, I guess I'm just going to have to put you in a cab.  I'm so sorry.  I was having such a lovely evening.

speaker: Ann
text: Well, maybe we could meet for coffee tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, um, all right, all right.  [_The waiter brings the check._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, thank you very much.  Yes, here, yeah, that's fine, uh, you just keep the change.  Uh, thank you. [_to Anne_] Uh, shall we?

speaker: Ann
text: You know, I'm just going to call a cab later.  There's no sense all this food going to waste.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frustrated_] You know what, I-I can't leave.  I can't.  It would be rude.

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, don't be silly!  Go!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  It's... not like he's going anywhere anyway.  [_Ann belatedly begins to be confused by his behavior._]

speaker: Ann
text: Okay, well, uh, are you sure you're not hungry?  You're welcome to try some of mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now that you mention it, uh, I guess I would like to try it.  Yes, thank you.

speaker: Ann
text: Help yourself.  [_He does.  He appears to have accepted the situation.  During the course of Ann's next speech, however, he begins to eat voraciously, eventually using his hand as well as his silverware, and after finishing, rapidly wiping his face with a napkin._]

speaker: Ann
text: Okay, well where were we?  Oh, that's right, my husband.  Anyway, he says he doesn't love me, he's bored, blah, blah, he's suffocating. If only, I say.  I would've gotten a nice little settlement.  I mean, we were covered up the yin-yang.  He had a sweet whole-life policy that paid double for accidental death.  I borrowed against it to get my Hyundai. [_Frasier has just finished off the meal._] Hey!  Who's the ravioli monster?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckling_] Roar.

speaker: Ann
text: You're worried about your brother, aren't you?  Maybe we should just go.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_eagerly rising_] All right.  Once again, I've had such a lovely evening.  [_They exit to the foyer._]

speaker: Ann
text: I hope I didn't talk your ear off.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can still hear you, so no.  Gosh, uh, you know, I'm parked out back, so I'll just slip out through the kitchen.  I'm sure the valet can find you a cab.

speaker: Ann
text: Oh, okay, well, here we are. [_smiling_] The awkward part.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's not awkward at all.  I'd be delighted to pay for your cab. [_He stuffs money in her hand._] Here we are.  Bye-bye.  [_He rushes back into the dining room and joins Kenny and Liz Wright._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi!  I hope I'm not too late.

speaker: Kenny
text: You know, I think I talked her into taking that Seattle job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, let me be the first to offer my congratulations... to Seattle. [_He takes her hand._]

speaker: Liz
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: And please let me offer my services as a cultural attache.

speaker: Liz
text: Well, I would love that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think this calls for a toast, uh, may I please see your list of champagnes please?  [_As the waiter exits, Ann re-enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stunned_] Ann.

speaker: Ann
text: I thought you left our date to go take care of your brother.

speaker: Liz
text: Date?  I-I thought you said you were just wrapping up a business meeting.

speaker: Ann
text: Is that why you ate all of my raviolis?  Because you were just trying to get rid of me?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, of-of course not.  Listen, there's a perfectly logical explanation for all this, which is...I'm sorry.  I've-I've go to take that! [_taking out his phone again_] Hello?

speaker: Liz
text: That didn't ring!

speaker: Ann
text: [_sarcastically_] It's very soft.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh, Dad, that sounds serious!  You stay put, I'll be right there.  [_The phone rings in his ear._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ow, that's loud.  [_The jig is up._]

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, Doc, what are you doing?

speaker: Ann
text: [_dejected_] This is exactly like my other date!

speaker: Liz
text: Kenny, I think I'd like to get to the airport a little early tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Miss Wright...

speaker: Liz
text: I'll meet you out front. [_to Frasier_] Excuse me.  [_She exits._]

speaker: Kenny
text: But, Liz!  This one hurts, Doc.  I had a souffle coming. [_He exits, leaving Ann and Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Ann.

speaker: Ann
text: I'm sorry, too.  Sorry for thinking you were different from all the other jerks out there.  But you're not, you're just another selfish, dishonest creep.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  I don't know what to say.

speaker: Ann
text: Well maybe you can come up with something before we have coffee tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as she exits_] Are you seriously suggesting that...?

speaker: Ann
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: See you at 10:00?
